speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when you first started noticing the black spots in your right eye?

speaker: Patient
text: "I think it started about 24 hours after I finished taking my morning medication. I was on my usual dose, but I didn't notice anything out of the ordinary until then."

speaker: Doctor
text: When did the black spots start appearing in your right eye, and have you experienced any pain or discomfort while looking at them?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started to appear a few hours after that, and to be honest, they're more like tiny flecks than actual spots. I haven't really noticed any pain, but they seem to be bothering my vision a bit, like I'm having trouble seeing things clearly."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your symptoms and whether they've changed at all over the past few weeks? Have you noticed any other vision changes, such as blurry vision or sensitivity to light?

speaker: Patient
text: "Yes, they seem to be getting worse, and the tiny flecks are becoming more noticeable. I've also been having trouble with glare, like the sunlight is reflecting off things and making it hard to see. It's a bit disorienting, to be honest."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you show me the black spots in your right eye, and tell me if you've noticed any movement or if they seem to be getting larger?

speaker: Patient
text: "I'm not sure if it's possible for me to show you exactly what you're asking for. I can try to describe them to you, but I'm not sure how well that will convey it. They're tiny, like I mentioned, and they seem to be scattered all over the right eye, but I'm not sure if I can accurately describe their exact location or movement."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the size of the black spots in your right eye - are they small, medium, or large?

speaker: Patient
text: "They're really tiny, like I mentioned earlier, I'd say no bigger than a grain of sand. I'm not even sure if they're truly'spots' anymore, they're just these tiny flecks scattered around the right eye."

speaker: Doctor
text: How long have you had HIV/AIDS, and have you had any recent changes to your antiretroviral therapy or any other treatments for your condition?

speaker: Patient
text: "I've been living with HIV/AIDS for about 2 years now, and I've been on a pretty standard regimen of antiretroviral therapy since then. The rest of my treatment plan has remained the same, though."
